alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 2:57PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL LINCOLN AND SOUTHWESTERN CUSTER COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM CDT... At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brady, or 22 miles northeast of Curtis, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Brady, Jeffrey Canyon State Wildlife Management Area, Etna, and Vroman. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 197 and 207. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and southwestern Nebraska.
